description: The word is associated with sitting under a lime tree, or having nothing more demanding to do than squeezing limes. It is also thought to originate from "limey", a slang term meaning a British serviceman during World War II (noted for hanging around bars and drinking).

entries.meaning: An application of lime (calcium hydroxide or calcium oxide).
(Caribbean, Jamaica, Trinidad and Tobago, slang) hanging around, usually in a public place with friends, enjoying the scene.
examples: "No Liming or Loitering - No Shouting or Loud Noise" (written on a sign in Port of Spain shopping mall).
